dsls.markdown:
##Time Capsules
A time capsule is like a treasure box, but instead of keeping toys and candy inside, it holds special items that tell the story of what life was like right now. Then, it is put in a safe place, like buried in the ground or in a strong box in a library, for many years.

When the time is right, someone will open the box and see all the special things put inside, and they'll know all about what life was like when it was buried.

A digital time capsule poem is similar, but instead of keeping things inside of a box, it holds pictures, videos, and messages that are stored on a computer or on the internet.

contained levels.long_instructions:
## Predict

Read this poem that captures a moment in time. Type an answer to the following questions in the text box below then click Run.

-   When is this time capsule from?
-   What was an important world event at the time of this time capsule?
-   What has changed since this time?

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.short_instructions: When you read this poem, what comes to mind? Find a background and text color that matches the mood of this poem.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.long_instructions: **Add a Background** - Find a set background and text color that matches the **mood** of this time capsule poem. - Click Run to animate the poem.

authored_hints.hint1: There is no wrong answer. Find something that looks right to you!
authored_hints.hint2: Click the `Finish`(#FFBD46) button when you are done.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.short_instructions: Now add a text effect to your poem.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.long_instructions: **Next, practice adding style to the text.** Choose a text effect that matches the **mood and imagery** of this time capsule poem.

authored_hints.hint1:
Use the dropdown to choose from different colors and effects.

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.short_instructions: Add sounds to your program to change how the poem feels while you're reading it.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.long_instructions: **Add sound to set a mood!** Choose a sound or music that matches the feeling of this time capsule poem.

authored_hints.hint1:
Sounds play for a short time, like a sound effect. 
[blockly block][0]

Music plays for a longer amount of time, like background music. 

[blockly block][1]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.short_instructions: Use imagery to paint a picture in the reader's mind. Add a sprite to illustrate your time capsule poem.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.long_instructions: **It’s time to add characters and objects!!** - Add a make new sprite block to your code. You can find this block at the bottom of the toolbox. - Choose a **sprite** to represent an artifact that would be in this time capsule poem. - Choose a costume for your sprite.

authored_hints.hint1:
Each sprite has a **location**. You can set the location by clicking the pin on this block: 

[blockly block][0]

-   Click the pin [][1] on the location block then choose a new position for your sprite on the screen.
-   Press the "Run" button when your code is finished.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.short_instructions: Let's use events to change the animation when the poem mentions something new.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.long_instructions: **Find a shift in the mood of the poem** Find a line in the time capsule poem where the mood shifts or something new is introduced. Use the when line ??? shows event block to change a **background, text effect or sound** that matches a **line** in the poem.

authored_hints.hint1:
Set the number on the event block to match when you want the change to happen. 

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.short_instructions: Sprites can do certain actions or behaviors over and over while the program runs.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.long_instructions: **Animate your sprite!** Sprites can do certain actions or _behaviors_ over and over while a program runs. - Add a sprite begins block to your code. - Explore different sprite behaviors using the drop down menu. - Choose a behavior that matches the poem. _Extra challenge: Add a sprite begins block to a when line shows event!_

authored_hints.hint1:
Does the sprite costume match on both of your red blocks?

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.long_instructions:
_Try it out_

In the next lesson, you'll write your own time capsule poem. For now, explore new blocks and tinker with different effects. 

-   Illustrate a poem however you'd like and share it with your friends.
-   Use the "Select Poem" dropdown menu in the top left to select a time capsule poem or enter your own!

dsls.markdown:
##Plan Your Time Capsule

It's time to plan your own time capsule poem.

>You should include: > - What you like to do > - What is important to you > - What is currently happening in your community > - A few current world events **Need help starting your poem?** Use this resource. **Just need some inspiration?** Use this resource.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.short_instructions: Code your own Time Capsule poem!
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-timecapsul.long_instructions:
**Code Your Time Capsule!**

Now it's time to animate your Time Capsule Poem. Enter your own poem and then add your code! 

_Hint: Go to the next level to review any coding skills._

dsls.description: Choose from the activities below to refresh your memory on how to add code to your time capsule poem! You can pick multiple options and do more than one!

csc_timecapsule_review1_2023.short_instructions: When you read this poem, what comes to mind? Find a background that matches the mood of this poem.
csc_timecapsule_review1_2023.long_instructions: **Let’s give our time capsule poem a background!** - Connect a set background block under when run. - To choose a different background, click on the image and select "More" from the dropdown menu. - When you're finished, click "Run". _Bonus: Try out different backgrounds, frames, and effects._

csc_timecapsule_review2_2023.short_instructions: Now add a text color to your poem.
csc_timecapsule_review2_2023.long_instructions: **Let’s change the text color of our poem!** - Connect a set text color block under when run. - Choose a color that you can see against the background. - When you're finished, click "Run".

csc_timecapsule_review3_2023.short_instructions: Set a text effect for your poem.
csc_timecapsule_review3_2023.long_instructions: **Let’s find a text effect that matches the mood of our time capsule poem!** - Connect a set text effect block under when run. - When you're finished, click "Run".

csc_timecapsule_review4_2023.short_instructions: Add sounds to your program to change how the poem feels while you're reading it.
csc_timecapsule_review4_2023.long_instructions: **Let’s find a sound that matches the feeling of our time capsule poem!** - Connect a play sound or play music block under when run. - Choose a sound or music that matches the feeling of this Time Capsule poem. - When you're finished, click "Run".

csc_timecapsule_review5_2023.short_instructions: Use events to change the animation when the poem mentions something new.
csc_timecapsule_review5_2023.long_instructions: **Let’s add an event block to change a background, text effect, or sound to match a line in our poem!** - Drag a when line ??? shows block into the workspace. - Connect a set background, set text effect, or play sound block underneath. - When you're finished, click "Run".

csc_timecapsule_review6_2023.short_instructions: Add a sprite to illustrate your time capsule poem. Sprites can do certain actions or behaviors over and over while the program runs.
csc_timecapsule_review6_2023.long_instructions: **Let’s add a sprite and give it a behavior!** - Connect a make new sprite block under when run. - Then, connect a sprite begins block and choose a behavior. - When you're finished, click "Run". _Bonus: Add an event block to make the sprite show up or disappear with a specific line._

dsls.markdown:
##Share Your Time Capsule
**Now that you have coded your time capsule poem, it's time to share it out!** As you view your classmates' projects consider the following questions: >1. What images and sounds did you see in your classmates' time capsules? >2. How were their stories different from yours? >3. How were their stories similar to yours? >4. How did their images make you feel?
